  15. [@@@alert unstable
  16.     "The Effect interface may change in incompatible ways in the future."
  17. ]

  19. (** Effects.

  21.     See 'Language extensions/Effect handlers' section in the manual.

  23.     @since 5.0 *)

  25. ‌type _ t = ..
  26. (** The type of effects. *)

  28. exception Unhandled : 'a t -> exn
  29. (** [Unhandled e] is raised when effect [e] is performed and there is no
  30.     handler for it. *)

  32. exception Continuation_already_resumed
  33. (** Exception raised when a continuation is continued or discontinued more
  34.     than once. *)

  36. external perform : 'a t -> 'a = "%perform"
  37. (** [perform e] performs an effect [e].

  39.     @raise Unhandled if there is no handler for [e]. *)

  41. module Deep : sig
  42.   (** Deep handlers *)

  44.   type ('a,'b) continuation
  45.   (** [('a,'b) continuation] is a delimited continuation that expects a ['a]
  46.       value and returns a ['b] value. *)

  48.   val continue: ('a, 'b) continuation -> 'a -> 'b
  49.   (** [continue k x] resumes the continuation [k] by passing [x] to [k].

  51.       @raise Continuation_already_resumed if the continuation has already been
  52.       resumed. *)

  54.   val discontinue: ('a, 'b) continuation -> exn -> 'b
  55.   (** [discontinue k e] resumes the continuation [k] by raising the
  56.       exception [e] in [k].

  58.       @raise Continuation_already_resumed if the continuation has already been
  59.       resumed. *)

  61.   val discontinue_with_backtrace:
  62.     ('a, 'b) continuation -> exn -> Printexc.raw_backtrace -> 'b
  63.   (** [discontinue_with_backtrace k e bt] resumes the continuation [k] by
  64.       raising the exception [e] in [k] using [bt] as the origin for the
  65.       exception.

  67.       @raise Continuation_already_resumed if the continuation has already been
  68.       resumed. *)

  70.   type ('a,'b) handler =
  71.     { retc: 'a -> 'b;
  72.       exnc: exn -> 'b;
  73.       effc: 'c.'c t -> (('c,'b) continuation -> 'b) option }
  74.   (** [('a,'b) handler] is a handler record with three fields -- [retc]
  75.       is the value handler, [exnc] handles exceptions, and [effc] handles the
  76.       effects performed by the computation enclosed by the handler. *)

  78. ‌  val match_with: ('c -> 'a) -> 'c -> ('a,'b) handler -> 'b
  79.   (** [match_with f v h] runs the computation [f v] in the handler [h]. *)

  81. ‌  type 'a effect_handler =
  82.     { effc: 'b. 'b t -> (('b, 'a) continuation -> 'a) option }
  83.   (** ['a effect_handler] is a deep handler with an identity value handler
  84.       [fun x -> x] and an exception handler that raises any exception
  85.       [fun e -> raise e]. *)

  87. ‌  val try_with: ('b -> 'a) -> 'b -> 'a effect_handler -> 'a
  88.   (** [try_with f v h] runs the computation [f v] under the handler [h]. *)

  90.   external get_callstack :
  91.     ('a,'b) continuation -> int -> Printexc.raw_backtrace =
  92.     "caml_get_continuation_callstack"
  93.   (** [get_callstack c n] returns a description of the top of the call stack on
  94.       the continuation [c], with at most [n] entries. *)
  95. end

  97. module Shallow : sig
  98.   (* Shallow handlers *)

  100.   type ('a,'b) continuation
  101.   (** [('a,'b) continuation] is a delimited continuation that expects a ['a]
  102.       value and returns a ['b] value. *)

  104.   val fiber : ('a -> 'b) -> ('a, 'b) continuation
  105.   (** [fiber f] constructs a continuation that runs the computation [f]. *)

  107.   type ('a,'b) handler =
  108.     { retc: 'a -> 'b;
  109.       exnc: exn -> 'b;
  110.       effc: 'c.'c t -> (('c,'a) continuation -> 'b) option }
  111.   (** [('a,'b) handler] is a handler record with three fields -- [retc]
  112.       is the value handler, [exnc] handles exceptions, and [effc] handles the
  113.       effects performed by the computation enclosed by the handler. *)

  115. ‌  val continue_with : ('c,'a) continuation -> 'c -> ('a,'b) handler -> 'b
  116.   (** [continue_with k v h] resumes the continuation [k] with value [v] with
  117.       the handler [h].

  119.       @raise Continuation_already_resumed if the continuation has already been
  120.       resumed.
  121.    *)

  123. ‌  val discontinue_with : ('c,'a) continuation -> exn -> ('a,'b) handler -> 'b
  124.   (** [discontinue_with k e h] resumes the continuation [k] by raising the
  125.       exception [e] with the handler [h].

  127.       @raise Continuation_already_resumed if the continuation has already been
  128.       resumed.
  129.    *)

  131. ‌  val discontinue_with_backtrace :
  132.     ('a,'b) continuation -> exn -> Printexc.raw_backtrace ->
  133.     ('b,'c) handler -> 'c
  134.   (** [discontinue_with k e bt h] resumes the continuation [k] by raising the
  135.       exception [e] with the handler [h] using the raw backtrace [bt] as the
  136.       origin of the exception.

  138.       @raise Continuation_already_resumed if the continuation has already been
  139.       resumed.
  140.    *)

  142.   external get_callstack :
  143.     ('a,'b) continuation -> int -> Printexc.raw_backtrace =
  144.     "caml_get_continuation_callstack"
  145.   (** [get_callstack c n] returns a description of the top of the call stack on
  146.       the continuation [c], with at most [n] entries. *)
  147. end
